nodes.title: review all map structures for proper locking if referenced in go routines
cache location bug on linux
nodes.body: when transitioning to a R version namespaced cache, the binary copying in https://github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/blob/master//rcmd/install.go#L439 was not updated to support, hence they are being copied into `binary` rather than `binary/rversion`

nodes.title: nil pointer error
nodes.body:
I just got the nil pointer error below when I ran pkgr (0.5.0) on Windows 10 with the attached .yml file: [pkgr.yml.txt](https://github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/files/3571737/pkgr.yml.txt) (.txt added for GitHum to allow attachments).

```
pkgr --update install
INFO[0000] R Version 3.6.1
INFO[0002] found installed packages                      count=253
WARN[0002] Packages not installed by pkgr                packages="[lmtest PKNCA censReg glmmML plm TopicLongTable xpose Rdpack sandwich gbRd formulops latex.makers bsd.report maxLik bdsmatrix miscTools PKdata Rsdtm]"
WARN[0003] error downloading repo r_validated, type: binary, with information: failed fetching PACKAGES file from https://metrumresearchgroup.github.io/r_validated/bin/windows/contrib/3.6/PACKAGES, with status 404 Not Found
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xc0000005 code=0x0 addr=0x10 pc=0x76788f]

goroutine 51 [running]:
github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/cran.(*RepoDb).FetchPackages.func1(0xc00016e0f0, 0x3, 0x6, 0x1, 0xc00049e060, 0xc000066170, 0x1)
        /Users/devinpastoor/go/src/github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/cran/repodb.go:132 +0x10f
created by github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/cran.(*RepoDb).FetchPackages
        /Users/devinpastoor/go/src/github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/cran/repodb.go:124 +0x2ea
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xc0000005 code=0x0 addr=0x10 pc=0x76788f]

goroutine 50 [running]:
github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/cran.(*RepoDb).FetchPackages.func1(0xc00016e0f0, 0x3, 0x6, 0x1, 0xc00049e060, 0xc000066170, 0x2)
        /Users/devinpastoor/go/src/github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/cran/repodb.go:132 +0x10f
created by github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/cran.(*RepoDb).FetchPackages
        /Users/devinpastoor/go/src/github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/cran/repodb.go:124 +0x2ea

```

nodes.title: download all package srcs to single dir for archival or starting cran-like repo
pkgr must more aggressively error on failed download
nodes.body:
when downloading packages, receiving a 404 or other issue where cannot download should not just print a warning and proceed, as the installation will obviously fail since that package does not exist

```
1388:{"level":"warning","msg":"bad server response","package":"cmprsk","status":"404 Not Found","status_code":404,"time":"2019-09-30T08:42:15-04:00","url":"https://metrumresear
chgroup.github.io/cran/2019-09-22/src/contrib/cmprsk_2.2-7.1.tar.gz"}
```



```
ERRO[0509] installation failed for packages: cmprsk
TRAC[0509] Resetting package environment
INFO[0510] duration:8m30.328218453s
FATA[0510] failed package install with err, failed installation for packages: cmprsk
```

nodes.title: updating description file should ONLY retain the repo installed from, not the original repo
nodes.body:
else this causes issues with snapshotting

For example in the original description given:

```
Repository: CRAN
```

after installing from MPN it will look like:

```
Repository: CRAN MPN
```

```
Repository: MPN
```

when detected that already Repository Field exists, it can change to `OriginRepository`

nodes.title: difficult to trace bug when doing multiple R version installs
nodes.body:
I remember going through this in a live code review, looks like it was never reverted. @Dreznel transitioned an info to a Fatal call, which exits right then, making the rest of the code a no-op.

https://github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/blame/1e295f9c3ccc76e2167eee848275ccbbbf62865a/cran/pkg_nexus.go#L45

Currently trying to debug a situation on windows where running pkgr plan/install on multiple versions of R consecutively to build binaries and the second R version fails with this error:

```
PS C:\Users\DevinPastoor\Documents\pkgrbuilder\3.5\2019-10-04> pkgr plan                                                                                           INFO[0000] Installation would launch 8 workers                                                                                                                     INFO[0000] R Version 3.5.3                                                                                                                                         INFO[0000] found installed packages                      count=0                                                                                                   FATA[0000] error downloading repo information from: MPN:https://mpn.metworx.com/snapshots/stable/2019-10-04  
```

If I change the name to MPN2, it proceeds correctly, so something is going wrong decoding the cache. This doesn't completely make sense as the Hash for the cache does use the R version explicitly https://github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/blob/master/cran/repodb.go

Unfortunately, this error is being swallowed until we do a new build

nodes.title: pkgr add fails on windows
nodes.body:
```
C:\Users\DevinPastoor\Documents\pkgrbuilder\3.5\2019-10-04> pkgr add pkg                                                                                        FATA[0000] yaml: line 4: block sequence entries are not allowed in this context    
```

I have tried both indentation styles

```
Packages:
- pkg
```

and

```
Packages:
  - pkg
```

and add still chokes

nodes.title: pkg random tmp install location is not actually random
Why isn't mrgsolve 0.10 installed on Windows?
nodes.body:
With the attached pkgr.yml file (rename from .txt to .yml) on Windows, I do not get mrgsolve 0.10 even though it is on the CRAN mirror provided.  Any ideas why it is not installed when running `pkgr --update install`?  As additional information, I already have mrgsolve 0.9.2 installed by pkgr.

I don't know how to check this, but might it be doing a lexicographical instead of version number sort to determine what is new?

[pkgr.txt](https://github.com/metrumresearchgroup/pkgr/files/3740420/pkgr.txt)
